meanings.definition: To surpass in beaming or shining.
meanings.sent1: The sun outbeamed all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile outbeamed the glow of the streetlights.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight outbeamed the moon, making it jealous.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm outbeamed everyone else's, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse outbeamed the storm, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.definition: To emit beams of light outward.
meanings.sent1: The lighthouse outbeamed light across the dark sea.
meanings.sent2: The torch outbeamed a bright light in the cave.
meanings.sent3: The lantern outbeamed light, revealing hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: The flashlight outbeamed its glow, illuminating the path ahead.
meanings.sent5: The firework outbeamed colorful lights, painting the night sky.

meanings.definition: To outshine or outdo in brightness.
meanings.sent1: Her radiant smile outbeamed all the other contestants.
meanings.sent2: The diamond outbeamed all the other jewels in the display.
meanings.sent3: The sunflower outbeamed the other flowers, stealing the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: The full moon outbeamed the city lights, casting a soft glow.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks outbeamed the stars, creating a dazzling spectacle.
